greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator - denominator in n-th harmonic number, 1 + 1/2 + 1/3 + ... + 1/n.
comment: The numerator and denominator in the definition have no common factors greater than 1. p divides a(p-2) for prime p > 2. - _Alexander Adamchuk_, Jun 09 2006
It appears that a(n) = numerator((3*(HarmonicNumber(n) - 1)) / (n*(n^2 + 6*n + 11)), except for n = 5, 82, 115, and 383 (tested to 20000). - _Gary Detlefs_, Jul 20 2011
Conjecture: for n > 2, n divides a(n-2) if and only if n is a prime. Checked up to 20000.
_Max Alekseyev_ proved (in priv. commun.) that there are no primes p > 3 such that p^2 divides a(p-2). (End)
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Harmonic Number
formula: Numerators of gamma + Psi(n+1) - 1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Aug 12 2002
a(n) = numerator of the n-th harmonic number minus 1.
a(n) = numerator of A027612(n-1)/(A027611(n)*n^2*(n-1)!), n > 1. - _Gary Detlefs_, Aug 05 2011
example: The 3rd harmonic number is 11/6. So a(3) = 11 - 6 = 5.
maple: s := n -> add(1/i, i=2..n): a := n -> numer(s(n)):
mathematica: A064169[n_]:= (s = Sum[1/k, {k, n}]; Numerator[s] - Denominator[s]); Table[A064169[n], {n, 35}]
Numerator[#] - Denominator[#] &/@ HarmonicNumber[Range[35]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 25 2016 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(h=sum(i=1, n, 1/i)); numerator(h)-denominator(h) \\ _Felix Fröhlich_, Jan 14 2019
(MAGMA) [Numerator(a)-Denominator(a) where a is HarmonicNumber(n): n in [1..35]]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Aug 03 2019
(Sage) [numerator(harmonic_number(n)) - denominator(harmonic_number(n)) for n in (1..35)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 27 2019
(GAP) List([1..35], n-> NumeratorRat(Sum([0..n-2], k-> 2/(k+2))) ); # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 27 2019
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Sep 19 2001
ext: One more term from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 28 2001
